verses.kjv: Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments, which the LORD your God commanded to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go to possess it:
verses.ct: These are the commands, regulations, and laws that the LORD your God instructed me to teach you, so that you would follow them in the land you are crossing over to take possession of:

verses.kjv: That thou mightest fear the LORD thy God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command thee, thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged.
verses.ct: The purpose is that you would be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God by keeping all his regulations and commands that I am giving you — you, your children, and your grandchildren — for your entire lives, so that you may live long.

verses.kjv: Hear therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily, as the LORD God of thy fathers hath promised thee, in the land that floweth with milk and honey.
verses.ct: So listen carefully, Israel, and make sure to follow them, so that things will go well for you and you will multiply greatly, just as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, promised you, in a land rich with milk and honey.

verses.kjv: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD:
verses.ct: Listen, Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
verses.ct: You must love the LORD your God with your whole heart, with your entire soul, and with all your strength.

verses.kjv: And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be in thine heart:
verses.ct: These words that I am giving you today must stay deep in your heart.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
verses.ct: Repeat them constantly to your children. Discuss them when you are sitting at home, when you are walking along the road, when you go to bed at night, and when you get up in the morning.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand, and they shall be as frontlets between thine eyes.
verses.ct: Tie them as reminders on your hands, and wear them as symbols on your foreheads.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt write them upon the posts of thy house, and on thy gates.
verses.ct: Write them on the doorframes of your homes and on your gates.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when the LORD thy God shall have brought thee into the land which he sware unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give thee great and goodly cities, which thou buildedst not,
verses.ct: When the LORD your God brings you into the land he swore to give to your ancestors — to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob — with large, beautiful cities that you did not build,

verses.kjv: And houses full of all good things, which thou filledst not, and wells digged, which thou diggedst not, vineyards and olive trees, which thou plantedst not; when thou shalt have eaten and be full;
verses.ct: houses filled with good things that you did not provide, wells that you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant — and when you have eaten until you are satisfied,

verses.kjv: Then beware lest thou forget the LORD, which brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
verses.ct: be very careful not to forget the LORD, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the place where you were slaves.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt fear the LORD thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.
verses.ct: Be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God, serve him, and take your oaths only in his name.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the people which are round about you;
verses.ct: Do not chase after the gods of other nations, the gods of the peoples living around you.

verses.kjv: (For the LORD thy God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the LORD thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.
verses.ct: The LORD your God, who lives among you, is a jealous God. Otherwise, the LORD your God will burn with anger against you and wipe you off the surface of the earth.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not tempt the LORD your God, as ye tempted him in Massah.
verses.ct: Do not put the LORD your God to the test the way you tested him at Massah.

verses.kjv: Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of the LORD your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he hath commanded thee.
verses.ct: You must carefully obey the commands of the LORD your God — his instructions, his regulations, and his laws that he has given you.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of the LORD: that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in and possess the good land which the LORD sware unto thy fathers,
verses.ct: Do what the LORD considers right and good, so that things will go well for you and you can enter and take possession of the good land that the LORD swore to your ancestors,

verses.kjv: To cast out all thine enemies from before thee, as the LORD hath spoken.
verses.ct: driving out all your enemies ahead of you, just as the LORD has promised.

verses.kjv: And when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which the LORD our God hath commanded you?
verses.ct: In the future, when your son asks you, 'What is the meaning of these instructions, regulations, and laws that the LORD our God has given you?'

verses.kjv: Then thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh’s bondmen in Egypt; and the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand:
verses.ct: you should tell your son, 'We were slaves belonging to Pharaoh in Egypt, and the LORD brought us out of Egypt with his mighty power.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shewed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his household, before our eyes:
verses.ct: The LORD performed incredible and devastating signs and wonders against Egypt, against Pharaoh, and against his entire household, right in front of us.

verses.kjv: And he brought us out from thence, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.
verses.ct: He led us out of there so that he could bring us into this land and give it to us, just as he swore to our ancestors.

verses.kjv: And the LORD commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the LORD our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as it is at this day.
verses.ct: The LORD commanded us to follow all these regulations and to be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD our God, for our own benefit at all times, so that he might keep us alive, as we are today.

verses.kjv: And it shall be our righteousness, if we observe to do all these commandments before the LORD our God, as he hath commanded us.
verses.ct: It will be counted as righteousness for us if we are careful to obey all these commands in the presence of the LORD our God, just as he has instructed us.'
